videos.title: Rasputitsa 2019
videos.description:
Rasputitsa is a Russian word for the mud season during spring when the roads become impassable. It is also a Gravel Race in East Burke, Vermont where people test their mental as well as physical abilities.

This year was a true mental battle, to choose to start the race and to stay in as it rained, snowed, and sleeted on us. Wet gear, frozen fingers and toes, 42 miles, and 4700ft of climbing. All in temps of 37F (3C) to 41F (5C) degrees.

This video is going to have a lot of water and mud on the lens but you'll get the idea. It was tough.

Follow along @
 - Strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/10732093
 - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mthistle/

videos.title: Rasputitsa - gravel racing in Vermont's northeast kingdom
videos.channel: Out of Collective - Ski & Outdoor Media Network
videos.description:
From the organizer:

"We are protagonists of community, freedom, and unity through cycling. 
Rasputitsa has a mission of cycling, community, and charity.  We call it the 3 C’s philosophy.

Rasputitsa is more than a gravel cycling race. It’s a homegrown self-supported challenge of the mind, body, and soul that instills people with a connected sense of place and purpose. It’s an authentic experience that embraces: The Unknown. Change. All people. All bikes.
We believe that all attendees should have an equal opportunity to participate in our event regardless of their race, color, religion, disability, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status or national origin. We acknowledge both conceptual and practical barriers of entry into cycling for folks outside of the dominant group of participants. Part of our work is to understand how social structures create or enforce long established patterns of exclusivity in cycling. We hope to create a safe and welcoming space for athletes, staff, and spectators from different backgrounds, identities, and abilities at our event. We do not tolerate harassment or intimidation and anyone doing so will be asked to leave the event and will be reported to race officials and the governing body, USA Cycling. We look forward to growing the cycling community with you."

The Out of Collective is the source for the most relevant Ski, Bike & Outdoor Reviews, Content, and Podcasts in the industry. Join us! 

WEBSITE - http://outofpodcast.com
INSTAGRAM - https://www.instagram.com/outofcollective/
TWITTER - https://twitter.com/outofpodcast
FACEBOOK - https://www.facebook.com/TheOutofCollective
TIKTOK - https://www.tiktok.com/@outofpodcast
MERCH - http://getthecollective.com
Business Email: adam@outofpodcast.com

videos.title: Racing gravel on some pristine Vermont dirt at Rasputitsa 2023
videos.description:
10 hours driving for 57 miles of Vermont gravel and teammate time. I joined my Velocio // Exploro teammates for Rasputitsa in Burke, Vermont in late April. My teammate Sarah Lange won the Women's race and all four team riders placed in the top 15!

Follow me on instagram: https://www.instagram.com/watt_wagon/

If you have any video suggestions, please share in the comments below!


The following friends support me either financially or with free stuff, so huge thanks to these friends:

Velocio Apparel, 3T Bikes, SRAM, Schwalbe Tires, HUNT Wheels, Kask helmets, Koo Eyewear, Apidura Bags, Fizik, Muc Off, Kogel Bearings, and Wahoo.

videos.title: The Gravel Community
videos.description:
Rasputitsa is Russian for the mud season when roads become difficult to traverse. The Rasputitsa is a psychotic 45 mile, insane, drop to your knees and cry sufferfest with an absurdly section so difficult that people won't believe your stories called Cyberia. 

Video Production: Peregrine Productions LLC
